channel.title: Comments on: A Quick look at the new IIF function in Denali CTP3
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: vince
item.dc:creator: vince
item.description: Mysql was proposing it for ages, it was definitely lacking in SQL Server. Great they thought about it for this release.<br /> Thanks for your time writing those functions dedicated articles Denis !
item.content:encoded:
Mysql was proposing it for ages, it was definitely lacking in SQL Server. Great they thought about it for this release.
Thanks for your time writing those functions dedicated articles Denis !

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: I can't wait to for the person who will mix nested case with nested IIFs....that is going to be a total mess
item.content:encoded: I can’t wait to for the person who will mix nested case with nested IIFs….that is going to be a total mess

item.title: By: David Forck (thirster42)
item.dc:creator: David Forck (thirster42)
item.content:encoded:
interesting. i’ll probably stick with the case statements unless it’s a IF(a=1,true,false) sort of thing because otherwise the case statements are more flexable it seems like.

example: case blah when 1 then ‘a’ when 2 then ‘b’ when 3 then ‘c’ else ‘d’ end

iif(blah=1,’a’,iif(blah=2,’b’,iif(blah=3,’c’,’d’)))

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
I added the nested example

SELECT IIF(1=2,’equal’,IIF(4=2,’equal’,’not equal’)) as Comp

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.description: Can you show syntax for IIF with more than 2 expressions? Will it be nested? As in other languages IIF can only have 1 true and one false.
item.content:encoded: Can you show syntax for IIF with more than 2 expressions? Will it be nested? As in other languages IIF can only have 1 true and one false.

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.description: How was your speed compared to CASE, Denis? Pretty much the same or did the new IIF seem to increase or lower overall performance on a large volume of data and its use?
item.content:encoded: How was your speed compared to CASE, Denis? Pretty much the same or did the new IIF seem to increase or lower overall performance on a large volume of data and its use?
